subchapter.heading: Create Eye-Catching Output
subchapter.p: Altova StyleVision 2008 features a unique graphical design interface for creating stylesheets to transform and database data into multiple output formats. Because StyleVision produces standards-conformant , , and stylesheets, plus , , , and Authentic form output , based on one design, developers and designers no longer need to spend countless hours hand-coding and testing intricate stylesheets to implement single source publishing and database reporting solutions.

subchapter.heading: Visual Stylesheet Design
subchapter.p: Writing even the simplest transformation stylesheets manually is a difficult, time-consuming process. It requires an understanding of elements, the language, and complicated rules-based document processing models. StyleVision 2008 abstracts away the tricky underlying syntax, allowing you to compose stylesheets using a visual design interface, which is easier to learn, takes considerably less time, reduces the occurrence of errors, and lets you focus on the creativity of your design. The designs you create in StyleVision can be based on any , , or relational database, and multiple sources are supported. For instance, you can create one design that includes data from both and database sources.

The unified design approach promoted by StyleVision allows you to implement , since one easy-to-create design simultaneously produces , , , and electronic form output. When your source data changes, the , , and output can be updated simultaneously with the click of a button.

subchapter.heading: Advanced Styles and Functions
subchapter.p: Applying eye-catching styles and advanced functionality to your designs is easy with StyleVision's drag-and-drop design process and intelligent entry-helpers. To create a design, you simply drag elements from your data source(s) onto the design pane, and StyleVision 2008 prompts you with options for rendering the content. You can insert static content, such as headers, images, etc., directly into your design, then insert elements from and database sources that will be rendered dynamically based on the source data.You can even re-use portions of existing design files when creating new designs. To help you apply layout and style information to the content in your design, StyleVision includes advanced entry-helper windows and dialog boxes for viewing and editing source elements and styles. Design styles can be applied using drag-and-drop functionality or by editing properties directly in the entry-helpers.

For Web page design, StyleVision supports all the elements found on today's advanced Web pages, including hyperlinks, (cascading stylesheets), JavaScript functions, and more. It even includes a JavaScript editor for defining functions that add dynamic, event-based functionality to your pages.

StyleVision allows you to apply styles on a local or global basis using drop-down menus and dialog boxes, and you can also import an external stylesheet to apply previously created rules to your StyleVision design. styles are applied to your output, and most translate to and output as well.

The table of contents capability, complete with its TOC wizard and context-sensitive right click menu, makes StyleVision even more attractive for . This is especially true for publishing large documents, which may have source content in or databases and require tables of contents when output to , , and/or .

In addition to defining advanced style and layout conditions, StyleVision allows you to design stylesheets and Authentic forms that support advanced functions such as complex table handling, rich input formatting, business logic validation, date control, and more. All these features, combined with the ease of visual, drag-and-drop design, make StyleVision an invaluable tool for Web developers and others who need to publish and database content in online and print media.

subchapter.heading: Authentic Form Creation
subchapter.p: In addition to rendering attractive , , and output, each design you create in StyleVision 2008 can also produce an Authentic form for use with Altova Authentic 2008. They simply fill in electronic forms created in StyleVision, and the source documents or databases are automatically accessed and updated behind the scenes.

subchapter.p: Altova Authentic 2008 offers an innovative approach to and database content editing that completely shields the end user from the underlying technology. Authentic presents non-technical business users with electronic forms that allow them to view and enter valid or database data using intuitive, forms. These electronic Authentic forms are created by designers using Altova StyleVision 2008.

Authentic forms can be based on any , , or relational database. And, since Authentic is offered under a free license, you can distribute the Authentic forms interface to as many end users as required free of charge.

subchapter.heading: XML and Database Content Editing
subchapter.p: Authentic 2008 is available as a FREE download in Desktop and Browser Editions. subchapter.heading: Industry Template Support
subchapter.p: In addition to supporting Authentic forms created with StyleVision 2008, Authentic 2008 includes built-in templates for saving data according to industry standards such as (Darwin Information Typing Architecture), , (News Industry Text Format), (News Markup Language), and many others. Using the Authentic templates, non-technical users can quickly edit and save data that is valid according to these widely-used schemas.
